Reviews.Content: Great hotel just came back from Frankfurt and stayed at the Manhattan for 6 days, very good location just 2 minutes from the mail train station and U bhan.its about a 30minute walk to the center and river, and only 20 minutes taxi from the airport.hotel staff where helpful and friendly, my room was on the back so it was nice and quiet, very clean and a very good size bathroom. there was a mini bar,tv and telephone. the breakfast is the best ever, a selection of breads and cake,scrambled eggs,sausage,jams,salmon,cheese,hams,fruit,cereal,yogurt and many other goodies, lovely :-)Will definitely stay again at this hotel,the only thing is the lift is a bit on the small size, and when busy you have to wait for it, to come to you. but its a small thing really.
Reviews.Author: donnaleemalta

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel next to the main Train Station This Hotel is on Duesseldorfer Street and is really close to the main train station (Hauptbahnhof).The rooms are clean and adequate. Breakfast is really nice.Within walking distance to Romerberg and all the main attractions. There are lots of good bars around the city but If you want somewhere really traditional, Zum Eichkartzerl and Adolf Wagner are two really good places and good value for money.
Reviews.Author: lmt032

Reviews.Content: Heat and the City       my bedroom
Reviews.Author: jaimie_es

Reviews.Content: Central hotel is ok but not... Good- Central location, clean, cheap, great breakfast!Bad- Central location was surrounded by druggies on the steps of the subway entrance, no AC and front desk staff was uninterested in helping.
Reviews.Author: KristenLund

Reviews.Content: Friendly historic city albeit a bit rundown, hotel is "okay" Arrived in Frankfurt early (6 AM), airport provided tourist info staff, very friendly, very helpful. Airport and train stations a bit run down, and in places a tad dirty, but city itself seems quite nice but very business like and not as touristy as I was hoping for.I would not venture out much after dark walking around in this downtown area, unless I was with others. We used the train, and went direct from train to hotel, not so bad (other areas are better).Tried to check in early (my wife was getting over a cold and wanted to sleep after the red eye flight) but hotel was (supposedly) fully booked so we could not get a room until just past 11 AM (normal check in is around 12 noon to 1 PM), sitting in the lobby for 3 hours. At first, the front desk lady was a bit abrupt (possibly overwhelmed with the hotel being full and her being alone on the desk), but eventually warmed up into a nicer human being.Hotel a tad expensive for what you get, but being downtown is convenient, especially being across the main train station, though everywhere is easy access by train (especially day pass) so this turns out not to be that important.Internet is way too expensive (everywhere around the area too, it seems).Room was not as spectacular as other similar priced hotels in other countries, but I cannot compare to others in Frankfurt (just passing through 1 night), but it was also okay to stay in (though with really dated furniture, possibly by choice).If staying 1 or 2 nights, there is a 2-day train pass that is more economical than buying single day passes.Breakfast was typical western and local fare, and acceptable.
Reviews.Author: NorthernComfort

Reviews.Content: Very handy location I stayed in the Manhattan for 2 nights with my wife ,daughter and daughters friend. We had 1 double and 1 twin room both a very good size for a city hotel and both comfortable and very warm after walking round the city all day .Our visit was for the opening ceremony of the Christmas market and we had an excellent time in Frankfurt in general which was much nicer than I had expected.To be honest I had wanted to stay in one of the more Boutique hotels like the Concorde or Townhouse but had left it to late to get a room at a reasonable price. That said I would say the location of the Manhattan is better as being directly opposite the train station you are away from the red light district (just) rather than in the middle of it like most of the hotels seem to be.We more or less managed to avoid the red light district all together by using the public transport system both tram and underground which stop outside the station about 50 metres from the front of the hotelThe decor of the Manhattan is a bit dated (80's ) but very well kept, and the breakfast buffet was great with a very good selection of food and help full staff.The reception staff where efficient and friendly and booking in/out could not have been made any easier. To sum it up if I was returning to Frankfurt I would certainly stay here again rather than I can't wait to stay here again, But may be that's the difference between a city and a beach hotel
Reviews.Author: itsonlymoney

Reviews.Content: Manhattan is Wonderful! After one night at the Steigenberger Hotel Metropolitan (see separate review), we switched to the Manhattan Hotel and what a wise move that was! For 75 euro per night we had a very large room with a king size bed, a sofa, a desk, a table, two chairs, a large closet, a very up-to-date bathroom, and 2 large windows. In addition a wonderful breakfast was included each morning. The staff was extremely accommodating and the decor was very modern with, of course, a Manhattan theme. If you're in Frankfurt for just one night or a week, this is the place for you if you're interested in being close to the Hauptbahnhof which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. While the trains are very accessible, you can walk to just about anywhere in the city from the hotel in a relatively short time.The only quibble we had was with the lighting in the bathroom - should be brighter. Other than that, this is a great hotel at a great price.
Reviews.Author: NewYorkIndyTraveler

Reviews.Content: very nice and good price Clean, comfortable hotel across from the Frankfurt main train station...the neighborhood (like all train station neighborhoods in cities) is iffy at night so it's good to just cross the street and be there. No problem with the check in; we had prepaid (around $95) through Travelocity.com, and the check in process was quick and smooth (no extra fees, which we have experienced at some other places, often in the guise of resort fees). Breakfast was good, and started at 7am which allowed us time to eat quickly and then get to the airport in time for a 9:45am flight to the States. Would stay there again!
Reviews.Author: KarenGH

Reviews.Content: I like the Manhattan Hotel Clean and nice designed roomsKind staff day  nightGood cold breakfast buffet
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not Recommended, but not that bad... I stayed at the Manhattan for a couple of nights. It is located accross Frankfurt's central train station, which is good if you came to Frankfurt on business, or staying there for a short while, and would like to have a functional, simple, hotel close to the Bahnhof (you don't need a taxi or anything like that / just cross the road). However, its location also means that the street is not really quiet (I had trouble falling asleep because of drunken people shouting down the street - and my windows were shut); it also means that the neighbours are a fur factory and several travel agencies representing the world's favourites dictatorships (not kidding here) and most importantly, that the whole area is too dodgy to let women or children walk there alone after dark - full of prostitutes, strip clubs, drug dealers, etc. As for the rooms, they are simple and functional (but not as amazing as the hotel presents itself on its website, Hotel Bristol in Frankfurt is much more impressive). The lobby is a bit small, and the lift is really tiny. If you're obese and have suitcases with you, others will have to wait for the next lift. The staff is very friendly. The breakfast is disappointing, but only because someone here has written that it is amazing. It is not bad, but it is certainly not that good. I've been to several better hotel breakfast - no warm breakfast was served at all (I like eggs/bacon/mushrooms/tomatos for breakfast, at least when travelling), except for hard boiled eggs. They did have cheese, salami, fruits and cereals, so if you're not into warm breakfast, maybe its not *that* bad... The waitress was a bit rude : she accidently spill juice on my wife, but only vaguely apologised, and then did not clean the table until we've asked her to. There is a great hotel, not really far away - Hotel Bristol. If they have vacancies there, I'd prefer it anyday, despite Manhattan's location near the Bahnhof.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Verrrrrrrrry good Hotel We had a verry nice stay at the Manhattan Hotel.The staff was friendly and we had a good breakfast. The location next to the station is verry good. The rooms are big and clean. The cost free internet terminal in the lobby is helpful.The rates are good. We paid 90 Euro for a double room incl. breakfast.We will come back!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Always our last stop in Germany This hotel has been our last stop before flying home on all our trips to Germany because of its location near to the Frankfurt airport (15 minute drive with gas stations on the route for that last fill up) but in the heart of the city. The modern decor is refreshing after the typical Bavarian hotels we stay in during our vacations. We always stay on the weekends so we can park right in front of the door to the lobby. I doubt if this is possible on a weekday. All the major downtown sights are within walking distance. The night manager, who also doubles as the bartender, has been unfailingly friendly and helpful. The new day manager was a bit gruff but did her job. The free European breakfast had a wide selection and was more than enough and the staff was quick to pour a second cup of coffee. The area was a bit scary on our first visit but we never had any trouble (it is downtown!) For those who aren鈥檛 driving, the train station is across the street and has a shuttle to the airport. This hotel is dependable and a good value for the money. Caution: the rates go up when there is a big convention in town.
Reviews.Author: RetiredCSM

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel that does exactly what it says I have read some of the negative comments regarding this hotel. I stayed in the hotel for one night in May have found the place to be clean, the staff to be friendly, my single room was a good size and very nice. The hotel is located across the road from the train station and beside the local metro, very convenient. The area was fine, I did not feel unsafe at all. The hotel is a cheaper hotel and therefore I don't think people shoudl be expecting a five star experience. I have paid a lot more in hotels and got a lot less in the way of comfortable rooms and service. I would recommend the Manhatten Hotel for someone who is looking for a good cheaper option hotel, that is conveniently located in the city.
Reviews.Author: Ciao_Bella71

Reviews.Content: Find Somewhere Else to Stay in Frankfurt Find another hotel in Frankfurt. Frankfurt is a young interesting city and other much nicer and safer hotels can be found in Frankfurt. The cost for this hotel is VERY high and even though it is located across from the train station, it has a dirty and run down feel. The staff are not friendly or helpful. It is located in a bad area of town and I really did not feel safe about leaving my laptop in the room. Stay away from this place.
Reviews.Author: Bloom

Reviews.Content: Sorry others had a bad time....Ours was GREAT My husband and I were breaking trip in Frankfurt on the way back from 3+weeks in India. We tend to travel cheap, opting for comfort, but at a frugal price. Our 3rd floor room was very clean and comfortable. We had a good experience with the staff...they were very helpful. Te day or two we stayed late in the room we were not troubled by room service staff as we made sure to put the sign on the door. The location is very good. If you are of the adventerous kind and want the flavor of Frankfurt this is the best neighborhood to be in....we've lived in New York, Seattle, and the Bay area, and have travelled much of Europe....this place was one of the nicest I've been at anywhere, given the cost.Also, they have the best included breakfast anywhere.
Reviews.Author: Jarucia

Reviews.Content: Great modern style hotel. Great location I stayed at this hotel at the end of January and was very impressed. Unlike a previous poster I had nothing but superb service when I was there. It had a fantastic location right across from the train station. I wouldn't wander around the area at night (red light district close by) but I felt safe during the day and early evening and there are so many amenities with the train station close by. My check-in was easy and so was my check-out. Staff were courteous and friendly. My room had a fantastic bathroom (shower only) and the bedroom was clean. Duvet was very comfy. I thought the breakfast buffet was excellent - courteous service and plenty to eat. Next time I am in Frankfurt I would head straight to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: SLin96

Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place!!! Terrible!!! For a hotel named after a great American city, they don't like Americans much. My husband and I stayed here two nights on our way to Paris. We spent 10 days in Germany and a total of 35 days in Europe this summer. We were in Riga, Latvia--Amsterdam--Berlin--Koln--Frankfurt--London  Paris. We traveled to Europe because I had to go to an academic conference in Riga, Latvia. This hotel is terrible. The one terrible place we stayed during our whole trip! A real let down after our great experiences in Berlin. The staff at this hotel are very rude and disrespectful. We paid for the breakfast buffet through Expedia, but hat to pay extra once we arrived. The bread selection was stale and seemed to be day-old stuff. The attendants watch you as you make your selections at the meager offerings of a breakfast buffet but are never around to bring you tea or juice. They make the American guest feel very unwelcome. Both my husband and I speak German as well as other languages. My husband was an exchange student and actually is very fluent,however, several of the staff members could not understand anything that we said in any language. Very unwelcoming and unhelpful. It is located in a bad area of Frankfurt that is loud and crime ridden~ although we were not robbed~you feel like you are staying in the bad part of town. The internet connect does not function in the lobby and the carpets in the room were dirty. The beds are uncomfortable and the bed frame was broken which left a big sort of U shaped area to sleep on. My husband and I woke up facing each other, smashed together in the center, with back aches,sort of like sleeping in a hammock! Bath room was clean but no ventilation and only one bath towel and one hand towel provided~so one person will use a wet towel to dry off after taking a very low pressure shower~a boiling hot shower~the temperature of which makes it hard to wash your hair! In the mornings, the maid staff come into the rooms early unannounced and if you try to stay in the room to read a book or write~you might be interrupted several times by the cleaning staff who let themselves into your room unannounced to perform checks. Terrible~terrible~ terrible place! Stay away from the Manhattan Hotel in Frankfurt!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Close to train station, better than most in the area This is about as close to the central train station as you can get - just across the street. Very good value for money, even the rooms to the main street are quiet due to triple(!) glazing. Small lobby, but nicely furnished.
Reviews.Author: Gernereiserin

Reviews.Content: convenient comfortable hotel Stayed at Hotel Manhattan in November 2001 to be near train in Frankfurt. Hotel was very nice, comfortable, had modern furnishings, roomy. English speaking staff. Everything was well explained. We liked location very much. Bathroom was exceptionally nice. We liked the Thai restaurant just across the street. We felt very safe in the area.
Reviews.Author: zoldiegoldie
